runs.comm: Windies go slam bang first ball. Short, and Smith goes deep into the crease, and pulls it to deep square
length ball outside off, and left alone
these are the most annoying runs a team can score. Gayle has ducked into a bouncer, he is not playing a shot, has been hit in the helmet, and has got four leg-byes. MCC, wake up and change this law
that's a wide, and a big one outside off
short of a length, on the pads, worked away wide of short fine for a single
short of a length, angling in, worked off the hip for a single
an increasingly familiar watchful start from Gayle. Left alone outside off
length ball outside off, gets it to shape back in a little, and Smith's wild drive is beaten
swinging in but too far, and ricochets off the pad to short fine leg
that's a right riper from Start. A ball and a half. Length ball, just outside off, swings in late, leaves Smith stunned, and hits the top of off. Smith is clearly surprised by this late movement
short of a length, swinging in again, off the inside half of the bat, gets a single wide of short fine
full, angling in, worked away to deep square
length ball, on off, flicked away to deep square
length ball, outside off, 85mph, left alone
Yorker, 140ks, dug out
full, wide outside off, beats the drive
seemed to be swinging with his eyes shut. Misses a length ball just outside off. That would have hit the fourth stump
they call this game hit or miss. At the moment, Charles is only missing. Another big drive tried, and he is beaten outside off again
Cummins may as well ask him to hold that thing straight so that he can aim at it. Driving outside off, and beaten by the slight movement away
short of a length, angling in, defended to mid-on
wide down the leg side
Gayle is still biding his time. Looks to work this shortish delivery to leg side, gets a leading edge for two past mid-off
swing outside outside off and a wild edge to third man it's dropped by Shane Watson coming in off the third man rope, tough chance diving in but he got there and should have held it
backed away, length ball on the pads and swung away over long on, good strike that
backed away and slogged off the inside half of the bat past short fine leg
length ball wide outside off, driven over cover point
covered up around off stump
back of a length outside off, hammered past midwicket, wasn't totally timed but enough bat on it to get it out for four wide of deep square leg
four into the same region, it was a touch straighter but swung into the same part of the boundary, only this blasted one bounce over the rope
well bowled, slower ball bouncer, Gayle set himself for the pull again but pulled out after the ball pitched
back to full pace and nailed into the stands over square leg, it was around middle stump and swung high towards deep square leg who thought he might get there for a moment but it sailed over his head
they are hemorrhaging runs here. Short of a length, into the pads, with short fine up, and he has placed it past short fine

more timber. Not as comprehensive as the first wicket, but Australia needed this more desperately. Seems like a slower ball that kicked at him, hit the glove as he looked to run this down to third man, and rolled over to the stumps. In fact it's a big offcutter that hits his arm and ricochets onto the stumps
length ball, on off 127ks, dabbed to third man
CH Gayle. Has. Arrived. Bowlers and fielders duck for cover. Backs away, takes a perfectly decent delivery from off, and smacks it over cover-point
slower ball, yorks a charging Gayle. Good comeback
Gayle backs away, looks to pull, seems to have been beaten by low bounce, but gets a leg-bye
short of a length, into the pads, guided past short fine for a single
that turned in, from full and outside off, but Samuels gets outside the line, negating the appeal
leaves the crease, is beaten in flight, and pads this away towards cover
wrong'un, doesn't turn a long way, Samuels reads it off the pitch, and has enough time to push this short delivery into the off side for one
easy does it. It's like pushing for a single to long-on in the middle overs of an ODI. Full, on off, and casually, effortlessly he lofts this over long-on
sweeps. These are not the shots for Gayle. The ball turns away, Gayle's one hand comes off, but he manages to make contact before the ball reaches the pad. Gets a single to deep square
oh hello. Maxwell is launched first ball. Nothing too wrong with the ball. On a length, middle and leg, and nonchalantly lofted over long-on. How cool is he
tries the sweep, beaten by a quick ball, gets a leg-bye
meanwhile, there is a different game on with Gayle not on strike. Samuels is beaten in the flight, gets an inside edge for a single

stop the press. Somebody has managed an appeal against Gayle. Fast and flat, beats his shot, hits him in front of leg, and this is missing leg according to the umpire. That really did look close to me, though
whoa... these stadiums are not big enough for Gayle. Same ball, flat, darted into the pads, but Gayle backs away this time, and pulls this over wide long-on - that went 95 metres before bouncing
bowled'im. No he hasn't. Oh, that seemed gone for a moment as Gayle swung hard and seemed to miss. However, he got a tiny little inside edge in front of off, and it missed everything
pace and bounce here. Short of a length, rising towards the chest, Samuels keeps it down, but can't get the single
length ball outside off, opens the face, gets Gayle back on strike
big wind-up, gets a slower delivery on off, opens the face, towards short third man
mis-hit after backing away, gets a single off the inside half of the bat
length ball, on off, nicely driven on the up, wide of long-off, gets a couple

Shot and a half. The best of the day. Slower ball from Christian, Samuels waits and waits, and then square drives it, bisecting the two men in the deep on the off side. It reached the boards before you could say four
some late swing into the pads, Gayle has set himself up for a flick over midwicket, but is beaten by the movement. Takes a leg-bye
full, angling into off, driven inside-out, gets a single
well bowled. Either he saw Gayle back away or guessed he would do so  and slipped in a full and wide delivery, which Gayle couldn't reach
misses the yorker, but the low full toss goes just for a single to wide long-on
yorker, dug out to straight short cover, Christian tries to run Gayle out, but concedes an overthrow. Gayle was back in anyway. Starc not happy, but trying to run Gayle out is worth the risk, I feel
full, angling in, can't get under it, smashes it to deep midwicket for one

there it is. The Watson effect. I don't know how, but he always tends to produce something out of the hat. Somehow. This is short of a length, middle and leg, hip high, Gayle looks to work this for a single, gets a hefty leading edge, Watson runs towards straight extra cover and claims it himself. Has Watson's drop caused enough damage already, though?
short, hurries onto him, lobs into open space into the leg side. That could easily have gone to hand too
short of a length, pushed wide of cover for one
lovely bouncer, 133ks, half way between shoulder and head. Beats him on the hook
short of a length, outside off, chipped over cover, gets a single
nicely played. Punched, on the up, gets a single to sweeper-cover
short of a length, turning into the pads, worked away for a single
leaves the crease, Hogg bowls flat, Samuels is beaten in the flight, defends it back to him
lovely delivery, dipping, pitching middle off, turning in sharply, hits the pad. Wade shouts from behind, "He is not reading it."
and he clearly isn't reading it. This is short, outside off, and he sets himself up for a big cut, but is beaten by the googly that leaves him as opposed to coming in
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
googly again, short of a length, cut away, but can't beat backward point
and he makes a good comeback again. Shortish, cutting in, cramps him up. Another dot
lovely shot. No room available here, and it is short of a length too. So he has neither the length nor the width but he punches this mighty fine, past point, and the ball races away
slower bouncer, pulled away, wide of deep midwicket, they take just the one
short of a length, punched to the left of Dan C, but he dives to keep the batsmen at their respective ends
slightly slower, short of a length, punched away to long-off

lovely shot. I tell you what, Gayle played a blinder, but some of Samuels's shots haven't been half bat. In fact they have been more pleasing to the eye. Length ball, on off, makes a little bit of room - ever so slight - and then chips/lofts it over extra cover. And inside-out it goes for a flat six
short of a length, turning in, makes room to punch it away for one
looks to hoick this shortish delivery, is beaten, but gets a leg-bye
short, pulled away from outside off, gets a single to long-on

is this a googly? Seems like one as Samuels looks to go straight at a full delivery, but gets a sort of leading edge towards long-on. Maxwell there is interested in it, but it keeps going and going over him. Let's stop calling them leading edges, they are the side faces of the bat
flighted don off, pushed to cover
short, turning in, cramps him up, but Samuels gets enough bat on the pull to send it past short fine leg for four
full, on the pads, pushed to straight midwicket
bouncer, 134ks, pulled away to deep midwicket
well bowled again. Slower ball, on off, moves away a little. Samuels aborts the big wind-up, but is beaten on the attempted dab too

There is no justice for the bowler. Watson has seen Samuels back away, followed him, cramped him up, but Samuels somehow gets enough bat on this to clear long-on with ease. This goes high, has the fielders interested, but goes long too
and it was telegraphed that a bouncer is to follow. Samuels is camping back, takes the expected bouncer from chest high, and absolutely hits the pants off this. Deep square leg is just a witness
full and straight, dug out for a single to long-on
flighted on off, driven to long-on to bring up the fifty. The whole dugout is up on their feet. Samuels raises his bat, shakes Bravo's hand. Lovely striking
good airtime on this delivery, full on the pads, worked away for another single, which brings Samuels back on
Hogg gets Samuels who hasn't always picked the senior spinner. Samuels leaves the crease this time, the ball is flatter, falls slightly shorter than he expects it, and the mis-hit carries to long-on
short, on the stumps, punched away to deep point
the long-off is very wide, and Pollard capitalises. The first ball, full, and he chips it straight, just left of the stumps, and the long-off is not even in the frame
turns in sharply, hits the pad, but is missing leg
and pat he goes sailing. Length ball, outside off, Bravo stands rooted, and chips it over extra cover for a six. What a very Caribbean shot
into the pads, worked away into the leg side
no-ball... that's not good. Oversteps bowling a length ball into the pads, goes for a single
and slower bouncer it is, pulled away to deep square for one
that's a useful delivery, wide yorker, beats his attempt at steering it fine
slower ball again, short of a length, waits for it, works it around the corner for one
another slower bouncer, pulled away to deep square, Maxwell fumbles on the one-handed pick-up and concedes a second
lovely bouncer, follows him like a stalker, and Pollard can't do anything with it. The head falls away as he swats at it
that's a kill-me ball. Length ball, outside off, and Pollard has murdered it to the left of the stumps at the non-striker's end
Michael Hussey, what a cricketer. This is a low full toss, Pollard flicks it in the air, Hussey charges in from deep midwicket, and completes a low catch diving forward
short of a length, on off, punched away for one
big wind-up, but Sammy doesn't get the length, and just bunts this shortish delivery for a single towards point
full, into the pads, driven to long-on
and he has still got four on off. Bravo makes room, Cummins follows him, sort of handcuffs him, but this thick edge from outside leg beats the keeper on his right
slower bouncer, Bravo throws the kitchen sink and the wash basin at it, mis-hits it off the cue end, gets a couple to long-on just because of the mis-hit
timbahhh. Cummins bowls slightly short of a length, Bravo makes room, looks to go ever extra cover. Bravo misses, the ball hits the top of middle and leg
full toss on off, that's a nice welcome, Ramdin cashes in with a steer past point. Hogg runs from third man, doves, saves one run, and then waves to the applauding crowd
Sammy wanted to send this to Galle, but the slower ball never arrived, and he pulled out of the shot
another slower short ball, Sammy is wise to it, but gets just a single to deep square leg
that's cruel. Sammy winds up big time, swings at a length ball, and the edge flies between the keeper and short third man

what are these bats made of? This one looked like a skier the moment this left the bat. Had I been at long-on, I would have set myself up for the catch, but this just keeps sailing and sailing over that man

everyone's a-stumbling. This is a sharp delivery, cramps him up, hits him on the pad, has hardly reached the 30-yard circle at square leg, but Sammy wants two. As he turns, Sammy stumbles, but Wade stumbles too as he tries to pick up and throw. Sammy makes it

this ball has been to the moon and back. Full toss, hits it high on the bat, and skies it. Warner runs in from long-on, sets under it, completes the catch, with fingers pointing up in front of his upper abdomen. That was slightly uncomfortable, but not for Aussies
more timber. Ramdin backs away big time, Starc stays full and straight, and hits the base of middle and leg. Cant blame Ramdin much, but Starc is on a hat-trick
Narine doesn't bother. He has backed away and creamed a short delivery over extra cover. Gayle would have been happy with that shot
